DataElement.preferredName: Molecular Analysis Bone Marrow Minimal Residual Disease Outcome Percentage 2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place percentage value for the molecular analysis bone marrow minimal residual disease outcome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Molecular Analysis Bone Marrow Measurable Residual Disease Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.:_The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques._The result of an action

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.preferredName: Bone Marrow Measurable Residual Disease Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques._The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 9/7/22 Released DEC per AK for cjl;

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Percentage 2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Percentage Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
